parameters: Looks like I can plant something here, but I need tools.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Ah, those gardening tools are all bent out of shape. There's an anvil back behind me, go straighten her out. You'll need an iron ingot, there should be a couple by the anvil.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>While you're at it you should go fill up your water bucket too at the well.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Dummy! I told you to go fill up your watering can at the well!

You obtained Gardening Tools and a Watering Can!
roam the castle walls these days.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Hmph... It's about time. \N[2] told me you'd be helping out today with the garden. Hope you're ready for a workout!
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Your name's \N[1], right? Nice to finally have you out here. We've
been needing more help recently, with the garden expansion and all. Will you let me show you around?
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Oh, fantastic. That's my favorite thing to do. Follow me.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>What the hell do you think, kid?! We're waiting for the berries to grow.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>There! Did you see it? The berries grew in!
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>It's all about timing, kid. Berries always grow in the daytime. If you scrounge around in the morning, you'll definitely find fresh ones.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Now, what I want you to do is collect all the berries in the garden. There should be four bushes, so bring me the berries and we'll continue your training.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>What do you know, kid? Maybe you've got a knack for this after all!
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Alright, follow me. I'll show you your next task.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>In this box, there are some farming tools. We'll need these to grow some
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Grab your tools; let me know when you have them.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Bring me back those berries, kid, before the sun goes down.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Grab your tools from this box here and let me know when you have them.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>My, aren't you special? Come with me.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>These are farm plots. Since the morning has already dawned, they are now fertile plots.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>Since the morning dawned? They only become fertile in the morning?
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Oh boy... Yeah kid, and not only that, they are ONLY fertile in the morning. Don't try planting crops at dusk or even noon.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>When you see the plot is all nice and plump like this, you're good to plant. Why don't you try giving it a go?

\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Fantastic work son. At this point all there is to do is wait until the crops grow. Crops likes these are usually grown in short order. Let's finish the more menial chores and check back later.
Wait 4 hours by pressing the P key
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>It's been a pleasure training you, kid.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>After you harvest the wheat, head to the kitchen. It's through the doors on the north side of the garden.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>See there, kid? Beautiful golden wheat. Go ahead and harvest them and bring them to the kitchen. You've been a great help today.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>You need to be patient if you hope to achieve great things.
A shiny anvil, looks like I can repair tools on here
Some fresh water, wonder if this could be used to fill a watering can.
This leads to the kitchen, no reason going there if I don't have any Wheat on me.
This leads to the kitchen, no reason going there if I don't have any Wheat on me.
This leads to the kitchen, no reason going there if I don't have any Wheat on me.
This leads to the kitchen, no reason going there if I don't have any Wheat on me.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Seems that rope leads out of the well, right back to the gardens.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Hey kid! You're alve!\. \N[2], is that you?
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>We're ok \N[4]! We were looking for you
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>Get up here! It's dangerous down there!
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>\N[1], \N[2] I'm glad you kids are alive. There's been some sort of siege
on the castle. Goblins it seems\. but there's something bigger.
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>That was incredible \N[4]! What you did to that goblin!
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>It's nothing kid, a technique I learned years ago.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Not right now \N[1], we need to keep going!
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>I agree. If we can reach the castle gates we should be able to  escape.
I'm telling you though, there's something bigger afoot here, goblins can't shake castle walls like that.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>What about \N[3]? He should be here by now anyways, we could really use his help about now.
\af[4]\n<\N[4]>If \N[3] was ever on time I don't think half the problems in this world would exist but that's not the case.
\N[4] joined your party! \N[4] is a \ac[4], that means he's adept at using canes and staves and is equipped with magical abilities.
I shouldn't touch this chest yet, don't want to be fired my first day on the job.
